title: Use the original UD/UCMDB admin or sysadmin instead of suite-admin
content:
It's highly recommended to use the shared administration user (suite-admin) to manage UD/UCMDB and Service Management. If you insist on using the original UD/UCMDB OOTB admin users (admin or sysadmin) to manage UD/UCMDB, perform the steps in this section.

To use the original UD/UCMDB admin or sysadmin instead of suite-admin to manage UD/UCMDB, follow these steps:

  1. Log in to the shared IdM (https://<External_Access_Host>/idm-admin) as suite-admin.
  2. Navigate to the SYSBO organization, and then click it.
  3. Go to Users in the navigation pane, and then click  in the toolbar. The ADD USER page appears.
  4. Provide values as described in the following table for the admin user, and then click SAVE.

    Field (*required)

    Description

    Name *

    Name of the UD/UCMDB OOTB user. Enter the user name as admin. 

    Display Name *

    Display name of the new user. Use admin in this case.

    Password *

    Specify a password for the UD/UCMDB OOTB user.

    Type *

    Select SYSTEM.

    Password Policy

    Leave the field empty.

    User Attributes

    Leave the field empty.
  5. Click SAVE.
  6. Repeat the above steps to create the sysadmin user
  7. Go to Groups in the navigation pane,  click the administrators group, and then click the action button in the toolbar. The Group Settings page appears.
  8. Make sure that this administrators group is associated with the UD/UCMDB OOTB role SuperAdmin with the CMDB application field.
  9. Scroll down to the Users section, for the Associated Users field, search for and click the admin and sysadmin users to associate them to the group. 
  10. Click SAVE. 

Now you can use admin or sysadmin to log in to UD/UCMDB with the super admin permissions.

Note  The newly added UD/UCMDB OOTB users admin and sysadmin have the same privilege with no difference between these two users. 

This is because, in the containerized UD/UCMDB, the UD/UCMDB administrator privilege is controlled by the seeded SuperAdmin role with the application field ‘CMDB’ in IdM. After you associate the OOTB SuperAdmin role with the CMDB application field to the administrators group, users under this group are pre-authorized with UD/UCMDB super admin permissions (with the Server Administrator Privileges flag set and the UD/UCMDB OOTB SuperAdmin role granted), and they can log in to the JMX console with full access and perform global JMX operations, such as creating customers and deleting customers.
